radiographic_examinations.findings: Subtle and minute stippled heterotopic calcification within the soft tissues, suggestive of a soft-tissue mass.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: In January 2000, radiographs revealed calcific densities within the superior portion of the glenohumeral joint and a small amount of superior glenoid involvement.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A mass within the glenohumeral joint, appearing septated and bright on T2-weighted MRI, with rim enhancement on T1-weighted MRI with gadolinium contrast.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: In January 2000, MRI confirmed recurrence. In August 2000, a second recurrence was confirmed on MRI. In August 2003, imaging studies demonstrated a large mass (11.4 x 10 x 7.2 cm) involving the suprascapular notch, the spinal glenoid notch, and the quadrilateral space. By June 2005, MRI showed multiple foci of recurrence and evidence of erosion into bone.
Although previous preoperative chest radiographs and two post-recurrence CT scans of the chest were negative for metastatic involvement, a lung nodule was demonstrated on a CT scan in June 2005.
